paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses various TTR variants, particularly T119M and L55P, in the context of their interaction with A-Beta peptide and implications for Alzheimer's disease.

patients.phenotype: protective mutation in Familial Amyloid Polyneuropathy (FAP)

functional_data.summary: T119M TTR was able to avoid further aggregation of A-Beta peptide, producing an A-Beta profile similar to the one treated with WT TTR.

variants.additional_notes: T119M is noted for its protective effect against A-Beta toxicity.
key_quotes: TTR T119M, a protective mutation in FAP patients, was also able to avoid further aggregation of A-Beta peptide.

functional_data.summary: L55P TTR was not able to inhibit oligomerization nor to prevent evolution to aggregates and fibrils.

variants.additional_notes: L55P is noted for its high amyloidogenicity.
key_quotes: L55P TTR had impaired ability to avoid fibrillization of the peptide.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant TTR variants were extracted from the main text.
